abstract: On Thursday evening, about 20 members of Occupy Museums, a splinter group of the Occupy Wall Street protesters, made their way from the Museum of Modern Art to the New Museum of Contemporary Art to a downtown gallery, protesting what they say is the conflation of art and commerce, the snobbery of the art market, and high ticket prices at museums, which they called the "temples of the cultural elite."
snippet: On Thursday evening, about 20 members of Occupy Museums, a splinter group of the Occupy Wall Street protesters, made their way from the Museum of Modern Art to the New Museum of Contemporary Art to a downtown gallery, protesting what they say is the...
lead_paragraph: The Occupy Wall Street movement took on the art world, sort of, this week, with a splinter group, Occupy Museums. Convened on Thursday evening through a Facebook, Twitter and Tumblr posts, about 20 people made their way from the Museum of Modern Art to the New Museum  to a downtown gallery, protesting what they say is the conflation of art and commerce, the snobbery of the art market and high ticket prices at museums, which they called the "temples of the cultural elite."

headline.main: Taking the Protests to the Art World
